div.p: A86/1465, unit 158, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to submit to you as the Minister, to whose Department the vote for the Exhibition in London
Colonial and Indian Exhibition, London, 1886. pertains, to take into favorable consideration the desirability of utilizing the information, which Capt Everill, the Leader of the New Guinea Expedition,
Royal Geographical Society of Australasia exploring expedition. would be able to afford during the Indian and Colonial Exhibition, — he being willing to proceed to London if merely his travelling expenses and some allowance for residence be granted him during the exhibition, no Salary being claimed. As in all probability some small sum need be provided for additional expenses connected with the Exhibition, perhaps the opportunity of securing the services of Capt Everill for some months might be taken advantage of. He would be able to afford full information on New Guinea from personal observation, and thus be of use in the measures, likely to be adopted by the Imperial and Colonial Governments, to bring about a form of administration, adapted to that newly acquired British possession.
